judges: Before Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and Mandarino, JJ.
Mr. Chief Justice Jones took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Curiam,
The court being evenly divided, the judgment of sentence is affirmed.
Mr. Chief Justice Jones took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Pee Curiam,

attorneys: Maxine J. Stotland, Assistant District Attorney, with her Harold K. Don, Jr. and Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorneys, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Carr, Appellant.
Argued November 20, 1973.
Before Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and Mandarino, JJ.
Gilbert E. Toll, for appellant.
Maxine J. Stotland, Assistant District Attorney, with her Harold K. Don, Jr. and Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorneys, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
March 25, 1974:
